Showkase - The Creative's Showcase

( words)

Introduction

This project was set as part of my college coursework. I was tasked to test my skills at UI and UX design. The project involved designing or redesigning a product interface to apply the best practises in UI design.

I decided to design a user-friendly mobile and web interface. This interface would allow designers and other creators to display their previous work or current projects. While this project is primarily designed to allow creators to showcase their work, it can be used for employers to explore the works of possible future employees.

The objectives for the project were:

  • Practice user-centered research methods.
  • Be able to evaluate and design user interfaces
  • Apply high level design skills and design thinking to design solutions for the usability and interaction needs of the user.
  • Develop graphic and communication skills.

Discover

I compared two different portfolio sites to get the data I need to design the portfolio site. I compared behance.net and dribbble.com because they are class leading portfolio sites.

Desktop Sites

First the comparsion of the desktop sites. Hover on images to expand.

Liking a Post

behance.net
dribbble.com

Comparison

behance.net
  • Too much information to take in on opening page.
  • Good text Hierarchy.
  • Contrast to split sections.
  • Stays Consistent.
  • Positive Reinforcement.
dribbble.com
  • Easy to follow opening page.
  • Complicated more information. Confusing for user.
  • Good Consistency.
  • Good Feedback to user.
  • Explains hidden features.
  • Good Text Hierarchy.

Uploading a Post

behance.net
dribbble.com

Comparison

behance.net
  • Easy to follow upload scheme.
  • Steps look like buttons rather than a timeline.
  • Hard to know what upload requirements are.
dribbble.com
  • Upload Steps simple.
  • Requirements are easy to follow.
  • Help for every form input.

Viewing Posts on Mobile

behance.net

dribbble.com

Comparison

behance.net
  • Good Use of filters.
  • Picture isn’t focus.
  • Too many menu options.
dribbble.com
  • Can change display view.
  • Search is hidden.
  • Big Exit icon.

Ideation & Concept Development

Here is where my ideas were generated. This started off with making a taskflow so I would know what screens to design later on.

Task Flows

Sketches

Rough wireframe sketches were then drawn to generate quick ideas.

High Fidelity Wireframes

High Fidelity Wireframes made using Balsamiq to generate life like wireframes which show details without having to deal with colour and other important aspects.

Desktop

Mobile

Final Design

After iterating and changing the mockups until I was happy. I made the final design in Photoshop.

Desktop

Mobile

Branding

Branding is an important part of every project. This project is no different, the logo needs to be unique and recognisable while the colour scheme has to be easy to work with while still giving the recognisablity needed.

The Logo

The logo is an important part of the brand and is needed to scream "SHOWKASE".

The final logo was created in illustrator to make sure it is vector and can be resized to different sizes.

The Colour Scheme

The colour scheme for the site is mainly purple because purple is both similar to blue and red. It is the colour of luxury, creativity and ambition. All of these are important for a designer.
